snippet: Troops in Benghazi prepared for a new assault on Islamist militias a day after heavy fighting in the city.
abstract: Armed units of self-declared Libyan National Army tell civilians to leave parts of Benghazi as troops prepare for new assault on Islamist militants; officials in capital, Tripoli, condemn actions and voice support for militias, which were part of revolutionary forces that overthrew Col Muammar el-Qaddafi in 2011 and have maintained bases in Benghazi ever since.

byline.original: By SULIMAN ALI ZWAY and CARLOTTA GALL
byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway reported from Tripoli, and Carlotta Gall from Djerba, Tunisia.

lead_paragraph: Troops in Benghazi prepared for a new assault on Islamist militias a day after heavy fighting in the city.

headline.main: Libyans Told to Leave City Amid Clashes
headline.print_headline: Libyans Told to Leave City Amid Clashes

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
